instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2530 no WIFI
threads.message:
Hi,
I have this old board, with no WIFI.
L3401 was water-damaged as well as 2 pins. I replaced it, but one of the pin is completely destroyed, and it goes directly to the processor. See photo : do you think it is possible to scrap until reaching a trace, and then solder to L3401 with a wire?

threads.title: 820-2530 no WIFI
threads.message: You have a test point on the other side of the board.
